description.value:
Void shackles are built from supernatural crystals that form in the Void—materials that dig painfully into the flesh of those they restrain. A set of void shackles functions as superior manacles, but while they are in the Void, the crystals fluctuate in response to the plane's energy, which increases all DCs to remove them or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Escape] by 1 to DC 43. If a check to remove void shackles from a creature fails, the wearer of the manacles takes @Damage[10d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save). While a creature is manacled, the void shackles attempt to counteract any teleportation effect that targets the manacled creature, with a counteract rank of 9th and a [[/gmr 1d20+25 #Counteract]]{+25} modifier to the roll. If the teleportation effect is countered, the manacled creature takes @Damage[10d6[void]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:37|basic] save).

Void shackles can be placed on incorporeal creatures as if they were not incorporeal. An incorporeal creature manacled by void shackles cannot pass through solid objects. Even a soul can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Restrained] via void shackles, provided the soul was of a 17th- or lower-level creature in life. A soul held in void shackles cannot move on to the afterlife, cannot become undead, and can be transported by simply transporting the shackles.

Activate—Affix Shackle 2 (manipulate)

Effect You affix the void shackles to a helpless or willing creature or to any 17th- or lower-level soul. The shackles grow in size to accommodate the wrists or ankles of any size creature.

Activate—Release Shackle 2 (manipulate)

Effect You cause the void shackles to open and release their prisoner. If you were not the one to affix the shackles to that creature or soul, you must attempt a @Check[will|dc:43] save.

Critical Success The shackles open.

Success The shackles open, but you and the shackled creature take @Damage[5d6[void]] damage.

Failure The shackles do not open, and you and the shackled creature take @Damage[10d6[void]] damage.

Critical Failure As failure, but @Damage[20d6[void]] damage.
